meanings.definition: The feeling that one's surroundings are not real.
meanings.sent1: During the movie, she experienced derealization and felt like she was in a dream.
meanings.sent2: His derealization made it hard for him to focus on his work.
meanings.sent3: The derealization she felt at the amusement park made the roller coaster even more thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The fog enveloped the city, creating a sense of derealization in the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: The derealization during the storm made the lightning seem like a surreal painting.

meanings.definition: The act of perceiving the external world as unreal or distorted.
meanings.sent1: His derealization caused him to question the authenticity of everything around him.
meanings.sent2: The derealization he experienced after the accident left him feeling disconnected from reality.
meanings.sent3: The derealization during the magic show made him doubt his own eyes.
meanings.sent4: The derealization of the cityscape at night gave it an otherworldly appearance.
meanings.sent5: The derealization during the eclipse made the sky look like a painting come to life.

meanings.definition: A state in which one feels detached from their surroundings.
meanings.sent1: Her derealization made her feel like she was watching the world through a foggy window.
meanings.sent2: The derealization he experienced in the crowded room made him feel isolated.
meanings.sent3: The derealization during the play made her feel like she was in a different dimension.
meanings.sent4: The derealization of the forest at dusk gave it an eerie, detached feeling.
meanings.sent5: The derealization during the concert made the music sound like it was coming from far away.
